results.title: Central experimental farm
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Cherry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Canada runs the largest system of experimental farms in the world. The headquarters of this system is the Dominion Experimental Farm in Ottawa, whose staff of experts is shown at work. Experts in plant nutrition, soil research, food preservation, animal husbandry, cereal improvements and the use of farm machinery are seen at work. In brief scenes we are told something about the aims of the Cereal Division, where scientists are working to produce better grades of wheat. Experiments in poultry breeding to increase egg production, tests of different varieties of commercial seed, and the development of better breeds of livestock are among the activities shown in other divisions. Farmers visit the farm and are given practical demonstrations of improved methods.

results.title: Celebrating Bird: the triumph of Charlie Parker
results.creator_credit: Multiprises, Pioneer Artists, Sony Video Software Company and Toby Byron
results.brief_description: Charlie Parker, famously known as Bird, won fame as the king of the hipsters with his virtuoso saxophone playing and innovative jazz. This work traces his life story from Kansas City to the New York jazz scene of the 1950s, tracing the short, somewhat tragic journey of a lauded and revered, if commercially ignored, musician. As well as providing key performances of signature tunes - Ballade, Yardbird Suite, Just friends, Koko, Confirmation, Au Privave and Kim Bloomdido - this work also comprises his only surviving TV performance, and interviews with Bird’s contemporaries. Contains wonderful vintage footage of Bird performing, plus tunes performed by Thelonious Monk, Louis Armstrong and Count Basie.

results.title: Cecil B. Demented
results.creator_credit: John Waters, Joe Caracciolo Jr, John Fiedler, Mark Tarlov, Artic Productions and Studio Canal
results.brief_description: John Water’s Cecil B Demented is an anarchic kick to the bloated carcus that is mainstream Hollywood feature films. No one escapes Waters’ skewered assault as he derides the mediocrity that now inhabits the American studio system. The plot is a compendium of Waters’ previous film work and favorite obsessions, offering up kidnapping, demented ciniphiles, scathing parodies (the highlight being the Forest Gump sequel, ‘Gumped again’) and highly specific sexual perversity. Steven Dorf stars as Cecil B Demented, the deranged leader of the ‘Sprocket Holes’, a gang of film fanatics hell bent on overthrowing the Hollywood A-list and out to “punish bad cinema”. Their insane plan involves kidnapping megalomanic movie star Honey Whitlock (Melanie Griffith relishing her role as the bitchy diva) and forcing her to appear in their own underground movie. What ensues is a wild parody of hollywood movie making, while Waters affectionately sends up his own days as a filmmaking terrorist. Cast includes: Alicia Witt, Mink Stole, Ricki Lake, Patricia Hearst, Adrien Grenier, Larry Gillard Jr.

results.title: Cat's cradle
results.creator_credit: Liz Hughes, Chris McGill, Luigi Acquisto, Film Victoria and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description:
The Father lies stiff and near-naked on the kitchen table. His family prepare his body for an outing to the cinema and then carry him through a bleak landscape of concrete roads and decaying factories. This short film combines highly expressionist black and white cinematography with an ominous atmospheric soundtrack. The result is a bizarre and perverse film that has the texture of a dream. Winner of multiple awards for Best Short Film, including prizes at the Melbourne, Edinburgh and London Film Festivals.
Cast includes Helen Rollinson, Ian Nash, Imogen Gough, Paul Bajada, Ryan Giddins and features William McInnes as an extra.

results.title: Castles of clay
results.creator_credit: Alan Root, Joan Root, Benchmark Films and Survival Anglia
results.brief_description: Narrated by Derek Jacobi this film examines the African termite and its intricately constructed termite hills. Special types of termites perform different functions inside the hills, including communication, cultivation of a special mushroom vital to their diet, care of the eggs, and preparation to start new colonies. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Celtic spirits
results.creator_credit: James Littleton, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: It is through music, rather than through battles or political events, that Canada’s Celtic heritage is explored. Folk-singer John Allan Cameron and fiddler Winston “Scotty” Fitzgerald, well-known Cape Breton musicians, are the on-camera guides and performers in this film about the roots of Celtic music. Against the backdrop of the rugged Scottish Highlands, the misty mountains of Ireland, and at Canadian folk festivals, an impressive array of familiar tunes is performed.

results.title: Celso and Cora
results.creator_credit: Gary Kildea, Australian Film Commission and N-AV Productions
results.brief_description: A film in the mode of direct cinema which follows the lives, over a three month period, of a young couple and their two children living in a squatter settlement in Manila. A succession of long “takes” is edited as fragments in the lives of the subjects. Begins with Cora’s attempt to find a new room for the family after they have been evicted from the previous home. Lately Celso and Cora face a crisis in their own relationship aggravated by the stresses of their daily life. Made by Gary Kildea with the local collaboration of Rowena Katalingkasan. Tagalog (Filipino) dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Cell division in the diatom hantzschia amphioxys
results.creator_credit: David Tippit, Jeremy Pickett-Heaps, Roger Leslie, Tom Soranno and Cytographics Productions
results.brief_description: Uses electron microscopy, polarisation optics and other techniques to show cell division in the diatom hantzschia amphioxys. Each stage in the process is described and explained.

results.title: Celebration!: 40 years of Australian opera
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This video celebrates 40 years of the association between ABC Television and the Australian Opera. The best performers, conducters, designers assemble in a gala performance. Unique archival footage from an early production of Mozart’s “The Marriage of Figaro” staged in 1960, to the more recent production of “La Boheme” by Baz Luhrmann is featured. Some of the performers are Dame Joan Sutherland, Donald Smith, Neil Warren-Smith, John Shaw, Joan Carden, Yvonne Kenny and Jeffrey Black.

results.title: Celebration of the senses: a profile of Eric Rolls
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Looks at the life, work and world of Eric Rolls through his senses. He reads from his own writings and shows how he uses the senses in descriptive narrative. Describes the way in which he senses the world with hearing, sight, taste, smell and touch.
